attributes.Title: RACE & PUBLIC POLICY IN U.S.
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Public Policy
250
Smith College
Explanation of current policy issues regarding race. Topics include voting rights, compensation, public and private education, bilingual education and affirmative action in employment. Recommended background: PPL 220 or a course in American government.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
20891-F15

attributes.Title: PUBLIC POLICY ANALYSIS
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Public Policy
220
Smith College
Analysis of the institutions and processes of public policy formation and implementation. Explores models designed to explain policy and also those whose purpose is to ?improve? policy. Develops and uses analytical tools of formal policy analysis. Examines the debate over the possible and proper uses of these analytic tools.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
20475-F14
